page.title: 16FARMING _ PASTORAL
page.content: The main occupation for people in our area is farming.The Vale is well suited for pastoral activities and this is shown in the high percentage of dairy farms.Many farmers diversify with beef cattle,fodder for the animals and a cash crop. A typical farm would keep a herd of dairy cattle of around thirty with fifteen beef cattle for winter fattening.Fodder is usually grown in the form of barley and grass and this is supplemented with high protein meal.Milk is generally taken once a day after the early milking to the Unigate dairy,thirteen miles away at Porth.
